issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify getTotalNumberOfStudents() as a no-argument method returning an int, but the solution implements getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests). This parameterized signature contradicts the exercise description and UML and will confuse students (and automated tests) about the expected method signature and usage. The solution also calls getTotalNumberOfStudents(true) internally, which ties the solution to the non-specified boolean parameter instead of the no-arg API shown in the specification.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem specification and UML by changing the solution's method signature to public int getTotalNumberOfStudents() with no parameters and returning numberOfInscribedStudents + numberOfGuestStudents. Update any internal calls (e.g., getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor) to call the no-arg getTotalNumberOfStudents(). Alternatively, if the boolean parameter was intentional, update the problem statement, UML and template to document and require getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests) so all artifacts match.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task description) specifies a method getTotalNumberOfStudents(): int with no parameters. The solution implementation instead provides getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests) — a different signature that changes how the total is requested and forces callers to supply a boolean. This creates a mapping mismatch: students following the problem/template expect a no-arg getTotalNumberOfStudents() method (and the tests/UML refer to it), but the solution exposes a differently named/signatured method, increasing confusion and breaking the direct mapping from requirement to implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem/UML by implementing getTotalNumberOfStudents() with the no-argument signature that returns the total number of students (including guests if that is the intended default). Update any internal calls (e.g., getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents, getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor) to call the no-arg method. If optional inclusion of guests is desired, provide an overloaded method getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests) in addition to the no-arg method, but do not replace the required no-arg API specified in the problem.
